commits.message:
redwood: Don't armor encrypted files/messages

...except in one test.

We didn't have GPG armor ciphertext, so we don't need redwood to either.
This will result in a noticable speedup during encryption. Keys will
still be armored when being stored in the database.

Tests make this a bit more complicated, we want to generate an armored
message we can post to the journalist API, so we make it an optional
parameter for redwood.encrypt_message() only. We have to adjust other
tests now that we can no longer easily look for the
"-----BEGIN PGP MESSAGE-----" string.

Refs #7022.

Merge pull request #7028 from kishanrajput23/update

Fixed Broken Link

build: print current Git ref at the top of the build transcript

Closes #6792.

Merge pull request #7019 from freedomofpress/6792-print-git-ref

build: print current Git ref at the top of the build transcript

build(extract-strings): don't version gettext templates

We don't use the "Project-Version-Id" header anywhere, so it's not worth
updating either manually or via "update_version.sh".

Merge pull request #7023 from freedomofpress/redwood-no-armor

redwood: Don't armor encrypted files/messages

Merge pull request #7034 from freedomofpress/7020-no-project-version-id

build(`extract-strings`): don't version gettext templates

fix: Git needs "--no-pager" under non-interactive SSH

Otherwise staging-test-with-rebase's SSH from CircleCI stalls on
"WARNING: terminal is not fully functional".

Merge pull request #7038 from freedomofpress/stg-strikes-again

fix: Git needs `--no-pager` under non-interactive SSH

issue.body:
## Status

Ready for review

## Description of Changes

Closes #7020 by removing the `--version` argument to `pybabel extract`.  We don't use the resulting `Project-Version-Id` header anywhere, so it's not worth updating either manually or via `update_version.sh`.

The new value `Project-Id-Version: SecureDrop VERSION` will propagate into individual `.po` catalogs on the next round trip through Weblate like any other translation or metadata change.

## Testing

- [ ] Visual review.

## Deployment

No special considerations.

comment.body: @cfm this didn't cleanly backport to 2.7.0 for me, so I'm going to leave it for you :)

review.body:
For the purposes of #6232, in stand-up today we (and subsequently @zenmonkeykstop and I) discussed that:

1. content review of translations remains the responsibility of Localization Lab and their reviewers, in Weblate's review process;
2. security review of translations (e.g., checking for malicious HTML or interpolation not caught by Weblate) remains the responsibility of SecureDrop maintainers, here in GitHub pull requests; and
3. we'll merge and backport the current translation update for each release candidate and then the final release tag.

On this basis, I'm tentatively approving this update for merge for `2.7.0-rc3`, ideally after #7034 and pending any new changes from Weblate.

commits.message:
build(extract-strings): don't version gettext templates

We don't use the "Project-Version-Id" header anywhere, so it's not worth

Merge pull request #7034 from freedomofpress/7020-no-project-version-id

build(`extract-strings`): don't version gettext templates

issue.title: `update_version.sh` should update `.pot` files too

labels.name: i18n
labels.description: Anything related to translation or internationalization of SecureDrop

issue.body:
## Description

Our `messages.pot` files have a `Project-Id-Version` header that is not updated by `update_version.sh`.  (E.g.: #7018.)  Options:

1. ***Don't* version them.**  Have `make extract-strings` `sed` `Project-Version-Id` out of these files, as we do for `POT-Creation-Date` for reproducibility.
2. **Let `update_version.sh` update them directly** as it does other files, via `sed`.
3. **Have `update_version.sh` call `make extract-strings`** to propagate the new version, perhaps erroring out if `make check-strings` indicates that they're not otherwise current.  (We don't want to include actual string changes with the version change.)
    * This requires that the virtual environment be active.
4. **Have `update_version.sh` tell the user** to run `make extract-strings` and amend the commit if necessary.

## How will this impact [SecureDrop users](https://github.com/freedomofpress/securedrop-ux/wiki/Users)?

No user impact.

## How would this affect SecureDrop's [threat model](https://docs.securedrop.org/en/stable/threat_model/threat_model.html)?

No security implications.

## User Stories
As a release manager, I don't want to have to remember to run `make extract-strings` after `update_version.sh`.

## Testing

pull_request.title: Have JI validate journalist key is valid
pull_request.body:
## Status

Ready for review

## Description of Changes

During the Sequoia migration, we need to export the journalist public key from the GPG keyring into a file on disk. We also needed to validate the key was usable by Sequoia (e.g. no SHA-1 binding signatures).

Previously the plan was to validate it during the postinst and error out if it wasn't valid, but if validation fails for whatever reason, then we abort, which interrupts the postinst, so, e.g. database upgrades won't be applied. In retrospect having the validation fail at package install time is bad, because it requires even more manual work to get an instance in a working state since you need to manually apply the updates after doing a key rotation.

Now we validate the journalist key during startup of the Journalist Interface, printing and logging an error if it doesn't validate and then exiting. This should bring attention to journalists and therefore the admin that the instance needs manual attention. We will also include information about this change in the pre-release and release announcements.

Fixes #7030.

## Testing

* [x] Visual review & CI passes
* [x] In the dev environment:
   * [x] `git checkout 40a53c07bae7fee643bddf6db62118638ad0b421 securedrop/tests/files/test_journalist_key.pub` (get a SHA-1 signed version of the test key)
   * [x] Edit loaddata.py to make it a no-op (comment out the if name == main block)
   * [x] Run `make dev`, the JI should immediately exit with an error message about the key not being supported.
* [ ] In a staging environment: (might be OK to defer this to rc3 QA?)
   * [ ] Set up a 2.6.0 staging environment, which should use the weak test key. Download it from `/public-key` and run it through sq-keyring-linter to verify it is using a SHA-1 signature.
   * [ ] Upgrade to 2.7.0. The upgrade should succeed, but the JI should be down

## Deployment

Any special considerations for deployment? Yes, see description.

## Checklist

- [ ] Linting (`make lint`) and tests (`make test`) pass in the development container

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,10 +25,28 @@ def prime_keycache() -> None:
                 pass
 
 
-prime_keycache()
+def validate_journalist_key() -> None:
+    """Verify the journalist PGP key is valid"""
+    encryption_mgr = EncryptionManager.get_default()
+    # First check that we can read it
+    try:
+        journalist_key = encryption_mgr.get_journalist_public_key()
+    except Exception as e:
+        print(f"ERROR: Unable to read journalist public key: {e}", file=sys.stderr)
+        app.logger.error(f"ERROR: Unable to read journalist public key: {e}")
comment.body: Just to scream as loudly as possible that there's an issue. I started with print because I thought it might be to early to use a logger, but no, the logger seemed fine, so then I added it in as an extra thing but figured leaving in the print could help and wouldn't be harmful.

pull_request.title: Have JI validate journalist key is valid
pull_request.body:
## Status

Ready for review

## Description of Changes

During the Sequoia migration, we need to export the journalist public key from the GPG keyring into a file on disk. We also needed to validate the key was usable by Sequoia (e.g. no SHA-1 binding signatures).

Previously the plan was to validate it during the postinst and error out if it wasn't valid, but if validation fails for whatever reason, then we abort, which interrupts the postinst, so, e.g. database upgrades won't be applied. In retrospect having the validation fail at package install time is bad, because it requires even more manual work to get an instance in a working state since you need to manually apply the updates after doing a key rotation.

Now we validate the journalist key during startup of the Journalist Interface, printing and logging an error if it doesn't validate and then exiting. This should bring attention to journalists and therefore the admin that the instance needs manual attention. We will also include information about this change in the pre-release and release announcements.

* [ ] In a staging environment: (might be OK to defer this to rc3 QA?)
   * [ ] Set up a 2.6.0 staging environment, which should use the weak test key. Download it from `/public-key` and run it through sq-keyring-linter to verify it is using a SHA-1 signature.

review.body:
The development-environment test plan looks good:

* [x] In the dev environment:
   * [x] `git checkout 40a53c07bae7fee643bddf6db62118638ad0b421 securedrop/tests/files/test_journalist_key.pub` (get a SHA-1 signed version of the test key)
   * [x] Edit loaddata.py to make it a no-op (comment out the if name == main block)
   * [x] Run `make dev`, the JI should immediately exit with an error message about the key not being supported.

```sh-session
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ git checkout 40a53c07bae7fee643bddf6db62118638ad0b421 securedrop/tests/files/test_journalist_key.pub
Updated 1 path from 7b9207952
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ make dev
[...]
 => Journalist Interface <= 
ERROR: Journalist public key is not valid: NoSupportedKeys("65A1B5FF195B56353CC63DFFCC40EF1228271441")

 => Source Interface <= 

 * Serving Flask app 'source_app' (lazy loading)
 * Environment: production
   WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment.
   Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Debug mode: off
WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Use a production WSGI server instead.

 => Journalist Interface <= 

[2023-10-27 00:21:33,390] ERROR in journalist: ERROR: Journalist public key is not valid: NoSupportedKeys("65A1B5FF195B56353CC63DFFCC40EF1228271441")

One of the development servers exited unexpectedly. See the traceback above for details.
Once you have resolved the issue, you can re-run './manage.py run' to continue developing.
```

Restoration unbreaks the Journalist Interface:


```sh-session
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ git reset --hard
HEAD is now at 7fd01d908 Have JI validate journalist key is valid
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ make dev
[...]
 => Source Interface <= 

 * Serving Flask app 'source_app' (lazy loading)
 * Environment: production
   WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment.
   Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Debug mode: off
WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Use a production WSGI server instead.

 => Journalist Interface <= 

 * Serving Flask app 'journalist_app' (lazy loading)
 * Environment: production
   WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment.
   Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Debug mode: off
WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Running on all addresses (0.0.0.0)
 * Running on http://127.0.0.1:8081
 * Running on http://172.17.0.2:8081
```

I agree that we can defer staging/production-environment testing to RC3 QA, but I'll leave this for @zenmonkeykstop to merge as Release Manager.

## Status

## Description of Changes

During the Sequoia migration, we need to export the journalist public key from the GPG keyring into a file on disk. We also needed to validate the key was usable by Sequoia (e.g. no SHA-1 binding signatures).

Previously the plan was to validate it during the postinst and error out if it wasn't valid, but if validation fails for whatever reason, then we abort, which interrupts the postinst, so, e.g. database upgrades won't be applied. Now we validate the journalist key during startup of the Journalist Interface, printing and logging an error if it doesn't validate and then exiting. ## Status

Ready for review

## Description of Changes

During the Sequoia migration, we need to export the journalist public key from the GPG keyring into a file on disk. We also needed to validate the key was usable by Sequoia (e.g. no SHA-1 binding signatures).

Previously the plan was to validate it during the postinst and error out if it wasn't valid, but if validation fails for whatever reason, then we abort, which interrupts the postinst, so, e.g. database upgrades won't be applied. In retrospect having the validation fail at package install time is bad, because it requires even more manual work to get an instance in a working state since you need to manually apply the updates after doing a key rotation.

Now we validate the journalist key during startup of the Journalist Interface, printing and logging an error if it doesn't validate and then exiting. This should bring attention to journalists and therefore the admin that the instance needs manual attention. We will also include information about this change in the pre-release and release announcements.

Fixes #7030.

## Testing

* [x] Visual review & CI passes
* [ ] In the dev environment:
   * [x] `git checkout 40a53c07bae7fee643bddf6db62118638ad0b421 securedrop/tests/files/test_journalist_key.pub` (get a SHA-1 signed version of the test key)
   * [x] Edit loaddata.py to make it a no-op (comment out the if name == main block)
   * [ ] Run `make dev`, the JI should immediately exit with an error message about the key not being supported.
* [ ] In a staging environment: (might be OK to defer this to rc3 QA?)
   * [ ] Set up a 2.6.0 staging environment, which should use the weak test key. Download it from `/public-key` and run it through sq-keyring-linter to verify it is using a SHA-1 signature.
   * [ ] Upgrade to 2.7.0. The upgrade should succeed, but the JI should be down

## Deployment

Any special considerations for deployment? Yes, see description.

## Checklist

- [ ] Linting (`make lint`) and tests (`make test`) pass in the development container

milestone.title: SecureDrop 2.7.0
milestone.description:
The carcinisation release.
Expected changes:
- Sequoia in place of pretty-bad-privacy
- Dependency updates (including Ansible)
- continuous localization
- misc bugfixes.

review.body:
The development-environment test plan looks good:

* [x] In the dev environment:
   * [x] `git checkout 40a53c07bae7fee643bddf6db62118638ad0b421 securedrop/tests/files/test_journalist_key.pub` (get a SHA-1 signed version of the test key)
   * [x] Edit loaddata.py to make it a no-op (comment out the if name == main block)
   * [x] Run `make dev`, the JI should immediately exit with an error message about the key not being supported.

```sh-session
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ git checkout 40a53c07bae7fee643bddf6db62118638ad0b421 securedrop/tests/files/test_journalist_key.pub
Updated 1 path from 7b9207952
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ make dev
[...]
 => Journalist Interface <= 
ERROR: Journalist public key is not valid: NoSupportedKeys("65A1B5FF195B56353CC63DFFCC40EF1228271441")

 => Source Interface <= 

 * Serving Flask app 'source_app' (lazy loading)
 * Environment: production
   WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment.
   Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Debug mode: off
WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Use a production WSGI server instead.

 => Journalist Interface <= 

[2023-10-27 00:21:33,390] ERROR in journalist: ERROR: Journalist public key is not valid: NoSupportedKeys("65A1B5FF195B56353CC63DFFCC40EF1228271441")

One of the development servers exited unexpectedly. See the traceback above for details.
Once you have resolved the issue, you can re-run './manage.py run' to continue developing.
```

Restoration unbreaks the Journalist Interface:


```sh-session
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ git reset --hard
HEAD is now at 7fd01d908 Have JI validate journalist key is valid
user@sd-dev:~/securedrop$ make dev
[...]
 => Source Interface <= 

 * Serving Flask app 'source_app' (lazy loading)
 * Environment: production
   WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment.
   Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Debug mode: off
WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Use a production WSGI server instead.

 => Journalist Interface <= 

 * Serving Flask app 'journalist_app' (lazy loading)
 * Environment: production
   WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment.
   Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Debug mode: off
WARNING: This is a development server. Do not use it in a production deployment. Use a production WSGI server instead.
 * Running on all addresses (0.0.0.0)
 * Running on http://127.0.0.1:8081
 * Running on http://172.17.0.2:8081
```

I agree that we can defer staging/production-environment testing to RC3 QA, but I'll leave this for @zenmonkeykstop to merge as Release Manager.

## Description of Changes

During the Sequoia migration, we need to export the journalist public key from the GPG keyring into a file on disk. We also needed to validate the key was usable by Sequoia (e.g. no SHA-1 binding signatures).

Previously the plan was to validate it during the postinst and error out if it wasn't valid, but if validation fails for whatever reason, then we abort, which interrupts the postinst, so, e.g. database upgrades won't be applied. We will also include information about this change in the pre-release and release announcements.
